CONJUGATES: dummies (plural noun) | dummied (past tense verb) | dummied (past participle verb) | dummying (present participle verb)
ETYMOLOGY: Mid 16th century, from earlier dumb (meaning 'mute') + -y (diminutive suffix). Originally referred to a mute person, then a stupid person, and later to a model or imitation.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A model of a human, used for display or practice, or a representation of an object for testing or substitution.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 人体模型，用于展示或练习；或用于测试或替代的物体模型。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The shop window displayed new clothes on a tailor's dummy.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 商店橱窗里的人体模型展示着新衣服。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Don't be such a dummy, you can figure this out!
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 别那么笨，你能想明白的！

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word that describes or modifies a noun or pronoun.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Not real; designed to look like something real but actually a substitute, imitation, or non-functional version.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 不真实的；看起来像真的，但实际上是替代品、仿制品或非功能性版本。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The thief replaced the real diamonds with dummy jewels.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 小偷用假珠宝替换了真钻石。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A verb that takes one or more objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To make a model or imitation of something; to prepare a blank version, especially for testing or presentation.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 制作某物的模型或仿制品；准备一个空白版本，尤指用于测试或展示。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They dummied up a prototype to test the ergonomic design.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们制作了一个原型来测试人体工程学设计。

REGISTER: General usage, with specific informal or derogatory connotations depending on the context.
